definition: fire/urgent/ammunition/fiery or flaming/internal heat (Chinese medicine)/hot (popular)/classifier for military units (old)/Kangxi radical 86
to warm up/to heat up/hot (of weather)/heat/fervent
deep water and scorching fire/abyss of suffering (idiom)
to carry on intimately with (idiom); ardent relationship (esp. between lovers)/billing and cooing

sentences.english: What can the plan be with Microsoft's purchase of hot startup Powerset?
sentences.chinese: 微軟購買火熱的創業公司powerset有何計劃？

sentences.english: Seems Charlie's in hot water…And she's about to get burned.
sentences.chinese: 查莉貌似陷入水深火熱，馬上要引火上身了。

sentences.english: Like a coating of glaze over earthenware are fervent lips with an evil heart.
sentences.chinese: 火熱的嘴，奸惡的心，好像銀渣包的瓦器。

sentences.english: As the film became hot, Alicia started to known by the world.
sentences.chinese: 隨着這部電影變得火熱，艾麗西亞開始聞名於全世界。

sentences.english: Their lives were filled with untold suffering.; They lived in an abyss of misery.
sentences.chinese: 他們生活在水深火熱之中。

sentences.english: The season's in full swing now.
sentences.chinese: 現在球季正打得火熱呢。

sentences.english: Such increases are pouring cold water on many once-hot markets.
sentences.chinese: 這些加息給一度火熱的市場潑了一盆冷水。

sentences.english: Diana always says that he has a hot bod!
sentences.chinese: 戴安娜總是說他是一個火熱的娃。

sentences.english: Jalapeno: A good name for a dog with a sometimes fiery disposition.
sentences.chinese: 一個好名字，有時用狗火熱處置。

sentences.english: At the same time, the background of Recruitment Huasheng agents throughout the country, joined in the heat.
sentences.chinese: 同時，華勝背景誠招全國各地代理商，火熱加盟中。

sentences.english: And with the hot bats came some good old-fashioned excitement in the Bronx.
sentences.chinese: 還有，一些像是來自舊時代布隆克斯區的火熱支援。

sentences.english: Delay flat hot heart like poured a pot of cold water, very disappointed.
sentences.chinese: 延平火熱的心就像澆了一盆涼水，失望之極。

sentences.english: We believe fervent and unceasing prayer should under-gird all our ministries and personal life.
sentences.chinese: 我們相信火熱與恆久的禱告是我們事奉與生活的根基。

sentences.english: Pathogenic fire-heat tends to consume the body fluid and leads to deficiency of it.
sentences.chinese: 火熱之邪最易迫津外泄，耗傷人體陰液。

sentences.english: Lee goes down well with the carrier bag people.
sentences.chinese: 李與購物袋公司的人打得火熱。

sentences.english: Are you blind, I'm making out with a 12, I am winning.
sentences.chinese: 你沒看到我正和一個12分的打得火熱，我贏回來了。

definition: to surge up/to rise/(of tensions etc) to run high
on the eve of/to be about to/to be on the verge of
to rise/to spring up/to burgeon/to be aroused/to come into vogue
to become hot/temperature rise/(fig.) to intensify/to hot up/to escalate/to get a boost
wind direction/the way the wind blows/fig. trend/direction of events/how things develop (esp. how they affect oneself)/public opinion (concerning one's actions)/publicity (usually derog.)/limelight
